instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 display not detected
threads.message:
Board is liquid damaged with previous repair attempt.

LCD connector on display board was damaged.
Replaced and display assembly has been tested on another machine and it is working but cant be visible by clients board.

Checked and pin 4 and 6 on J8500 was bend so replaced J8500 and display still not visible.
Works fine on external display.

Checked all pads of J8500 and all traces are connected.

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00923 display not detected
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings on J8500 pads with good board.
You may consider using some fast tester.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://es.aliexpress.com/item/1005004992130938.html?spm=a2g0o.cart.0.0.416a7a9dba1SjM∓=1&gatewayAdapt=glo2esp[/URL]

DP_INT_HPD comes high?
Check with LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-00923 display not detected
threads.message:
Thank you for that tool - that will help for sure.

DP_INT_HPD in diode mode is fine but when board turned with screen connected it is low at 0.002V.
